|brand = Nintendo |model = Switch |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = HAC-001 |page_start_date = 03/13/2020 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.wi-cat.ru/Nintendo_Switch |wlclass = AC1200 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = portable game console |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = BKEHAC001 |icid = 4360A-HAC001 |us_id = <!-- us id number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = nVIDIA;Tegra X1;ODNX02-A2; |cpu1_cores = 8 |cpu1_type = ARM |cpu1_type_rev = v8<!-- 4x ARM Cortex-A57 4x ARM Cortex-A53 --> |cpu1spd = 1.0 GHz |bus = 64-bit
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Toshiba;THGBMHG8C2LBAIL; |flash1size = 32 GiB |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- 3400,3333,3300,3200,3100,3000,2800,2666,2600,2400,2133,2000,1866,1600,1066,1333,800 --> |ram1size = 4 GiB |ram1chip = Samsung;K4F6E304HB-MGCH; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_none = true |oui = <!-- Wireless OUI -->
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = <!-- Expansion Interface types, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sim_num = <!-- Number of sim Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_pcmcia_num = <!-- Number of pcmcia ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_expcard_num = <!-- Number of Expresscard ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipci_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCI Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipcie_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCIexpress Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_usb_num = <!-- Number of USB Ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_cf_num = <!-- Number Compact Flash Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sdmmc_num = <!-- Number SD/MMC Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ide_num = <!-- Number of ide ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ata_num = <!-- Number of ATA Ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sata_num = <!-- Number of sata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_esata_num = <!-- Number of esata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_parallel = <!-- Number of parallel ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sfp_num = <!-- Number of sfp ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_M.2 = <!-- Number of M.2 ports, Leave blank for none --> |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = BAT |pwr_vdc = 15 |pwr_amp_dc = 2.6 |pwr_bat = 3.7 |pwr_bat_amp = |pwr_bat_type = Li-Ion |pwr_bat_mAh = 4310 |pwr_bat_cells = |pwr_conn = USB Type-C
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = Bluetooth 4.1, SD Card slot, Audio 3.5 mm jack, speakers, fan, |addchip = Audio Codec;Realtek;ALC5639;;1; ,,, USB 3.0/DP1.2 Matrix Switch;Pericom;PI3USB30532;;1; ,,, Three Phase Buck Regulator;Maxim;MAX77621AEWI+T;;2; ,,, Power Management IC;Maxim;MAX77620AEWJ+T;;1; ,,, Power Management IC;Maxim;MAX;M92T36, 630380;1; ,,, <!-- Accelerometer Chip;STMicro;B1633; GCBRG, HAC STD, T1001216;1; --> Bluetooth 4.1, 2.4GHz Transceiver;Broadcom;BCM20734;;1; ,,, NFC reader IC;STMicroelectronics;NFCBEA;812006, 33;;1; ,,, 4Mb CMOS Flash;Macronix;MX25U4033E;;1; ,,, |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |category = portable game console
|defaulip = <!-- ???.???.???.???, default IP Address --> |defaultlogin = <!-- default Login Name, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Foxconn |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 12/25/2016 |estreldate = 03/03/2017 |estprice = 250 |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B07VGRJDF |asin_country = US |asin2 = B01LTHP2ZK |asin_country2 = UK |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|rad1mod = <!-- Radio module name, optional link, Leave blank for none --> |rad1modif = SDIO |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4356; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |rad1ac = 867 |rad1n = 300/300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 2.4 or 5 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== ===Specifications=== *[https://www.ifixit.com/Teardown/Nintendo+Switch+Teardown/78263 ''Nintendo Switch'' Teardown on '''iFixit'''] <!-- :System-on-chip used: Nvidia Tegra X1 T210 (ODNX02-A2) :CPU: Quad-core Cortex-A57 + Quad-core Cortex-A53 @1GHz :Memory: 4GB LPDDR4; Storage: 32GB eMMC :Removable storage: microSD/HC/XC (up to 2TB) :Operating system: Nintendo Switch system software
:;Motherboard (Console): :CPU: NVIDIA X1 T210 (ODNX02-A2) (Tegra X1 SoC); GPU: GM20B Maxell core :Toshiba THGBMHG8C2LBAIL - 32GB eMMC NAND Flash IC (module) ::Samsung KLMBG2JENB - 32GB eMMC NAND Flash IC (module) • (TI)* :Samsung K4F6E304HB-MGCH - 2GB LPDDR4 SDRAM (x2 for a total of 4GB) :Broadcom/Cypress BCM4356 - 802.11ac 2×2 + Bluetooth 4.1 SoC :Pericom Semiconductor PI3USB30532 - USB 3.0 / DP1.2 matrix switch :STMicroelectronics FT9CJ - Capacitive touchscreen controller :STMicroelectronics SH641 - 6-axis Accelerometer / Gyroscope ::(ultra-low power MEMS inertial sensor) B1633 GCBRG HAC STD T1001216 :Maxim Integrated MAX77621AEWI+T - Three phase buck regulator (x2) :Maxim Integrated MAX77620AEWJ+T - PMIC :Rohm M92T36 (630380) - Power Management IC :Texas Instruments BQ24193 - Battery charger :Realtek ALC5639 - Audio Codec :Delta Electronics fan - 5V/0.33A
:;Module (Joy-Con): :Broadcom BCM20734UA1 - Bluetooth 4.1 / 2.4 GHz Transceiver ::Cypress CYW20734 - Bluetooth 4.1 / 2.4 GHz Transceiver ([https://github.com/dekuNukem/Nintendo_Switch_Reverse_Engineering/issues/74 new])* :Macronix International MX25U4033E - 4Mb Serial CMOS Flash (1x); WTR5975 (?) :OmniVision IR Camera Module - motion IR camera, CMOS image sensor (right Joy-Con) :STMicroelectronics NFCBEA B123D6 (812006 33) - NFC reader IC (right Joy-Con) :STMicroelectronics LD39020D - 200ma low dropout regulator (LDO - 9L1T) :STMicroelectronics SH627 - 6-axis accelerometer and gyroscope ::ultra-low power MEMS inertial sensor LSM6DS3 family, system-in-package ::featuring a 3D digital accelerometer and a 3D gyroscope :Texas Instruments BQ24072 (“CKP” package markings) - Battery charger
:;Docking station :MCU: STMicroelectronics STM32F048 - Microcontroller ::STMicroelectronics 32P048 (likely MCU) :VIA Labs VL210-Q4 - USB 3.0 Hub controller :Macronix MX25V2006E - 2Mb Serial NOR Flash :Macronix MX25L512E - 512Kb Serial NOR Flash :MegaChips STDP2550 - Mobility DisplayPort (MyDP) to HDMI converter :Texas Instruments TLV62130ARGT (“VUNI”) DC/DC converter :Rohm M92T55 - Power Management IC (?) :Rohm M92T17 - Power Management IC (?) --> *[https://www.cirmall.com/articles/29019 ''Nintendo Switch (NS)'' Teardown on '''Cirmall'''] :CPU: [[nVIDIA]] Tegra X1 T210B01 (16nm) :Tegra X1 (20nm), RAM: LPDDR4 (LPDDR4X) *[https://www.techinsights.com/blog/nintendo-switch-teardown ''Nintendo Switch'' Teardown on '''TechInsights'''] *[https://github.com/dekuNukem/Nintendo_Switch_Reverse_Engineering ''Nintendo Switch'' Reverse Engineering on '''dekuNukem''']
==Links of Interest== {{WPLink|Nintendo_Switch}} (HAC-001) {{See also|Nintendo 3DS (CTR-001)}}
===Models=== *[[Nintendo Switch]] (HAC-001) (2017) <!-- :LCD: 6.2", 1280×720 (237 ppi), 32GB eMMC --> *[[Nintendo Switch Lite]] (HDH-001/002) (2019) <!-- :LCD: 5,5", 1280×720 (237 ppi), 32GB eMMC --> *[[Nintendo Switch OLED]] (HEG-001) (2021) <!-- :OLED: 7", 1280×720 (210 ppi), 64GB eMMC --> *[[Nintendo Classic Mini (CLV-101)]] (2016) <!-- • HoneyLab • CPU: Allwinner R16 (Quad Core ARM Cortex-A7) • GPU: Mali-400MP2; Flash: Macronix (NAND); RAM: Nanya --> *[[Nintendo Classic Super]] (EU/AU) (2017)
==See also== :;[[Nintendo]] • [[Sony PlayStation Devices]] *[[Nintendo 2DS (FTR-001)]] *[[Nintendo 3DS (CTR-001)]] • [http://www.ifixit.com/Teardown/Nintendo-3DS-Teardown/5029/ Teardown] *[[Nintendo 3DS XL (SPR-001)]] <!-- 2015 ?? • Nintendo 1446 17 CPU LGR A - ARM Core • Samsung KLM4G1YEMD-B031 4GB - NAND Flash • Fujitsu 82MK9A9A 7LFCRAM 1445 962 - FCRAM • Atheros AR6014G-AL1C - Wi-Fi SOC • NXP S750 1603 TSD438C - Infrared IC --> *[[Nintendo 3DS New (CTR-002)]] *[[Nintendo 3DS XL New (SPR-002)]] • [https://ifixit.org/blog/7028/nintendo-3ds-xl/ Teardown] <!-- 2015 • [https://www.slashgear.com/nintendo-3ds-xl-2015-teardown-inside-the-tiny-computer-13368984/ Teardown] • Nintendo 1446 17 CPU LGR A (CPU ARM core) • Samsung KLM4G1YEMD-B031 4GB - NAND Flash • Fujitsu 82MK9A9A 7LFCRAM 1445 962 - FCRAM • Atheros AR6014G-AL1C - Wi-Fi SoC • Texas Instruments 93045A4 49AF3NW G2 (Power Management IC) • Renesas Electronics UC KTR 442KM13 TK14 - MCU • Texas Instruments AIC3010D 48C01JW (Codec IC) • NXP S750 1603 TSD438C - Infrared IC • Texas Instruments PH416A - I/O Expander --> *[[Nintendo N3DS (KTR-001)]] *[[Nintendo N3DS XL (RED-001)]] *[[Nintendo N2DS XL (JAN-001)]]
